page.title: 15HOUSING IN TYWARDREATH
page.content: In our 12 sq. km we have 11 sq. km which have very few houses, there are only scattered farms nearly all fairly old. {The 1 sq. km which is left is full of {houses which make the village of {Tywardreath.}The houses grew out from the church. The oldest houses are near the church. These houses have no garages, no front gardens and are terraced. Most were built of granite. Gradually more houses were built, just one or two at a time. These houses were quite big and had big gardens. Since the war in 1945 a big expansion has been made. More houses have been built since 1945 than all the other houses put together. First Poldrea, a council housing estate, with 66 houses. In the last 15 years 2 private estates have been built with gardens and somewhere to park the car.
